simplified: Now NASA is trying to find and record smaller asteroids, 140 metres wide or more. Scientists think there are about 25,000 of this size. So far, they have recorded about 8,000. About 17,000 are still not found. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded over the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia. It injured 1,200 people. This shows that these middle-sized asteroids can be very dangerous if they enter Earth's orbit.

Complex Document: Now NASA is working towards logging some of the smaller asteroids, those measuring 140 metres wide or more. Of the 25,000 estimated asteroids of this size, so far about 8,000 have been logged, leaving 17,000 unaccounted for. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid that exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output: Now NASA is trying to find and record smaller asteroids, 140 metres wide or more. Scientists think there are about 25,000 of this size. So far, they have recorded about 8,000. About 17,000 are still not found. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded over the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia. It injured 1,200 people. This shows that these middle-sized asteroids can be very dangerous if they enter Earth's orbit.

simplified:
NASA is now working to find and record smaller asteroids, which are 140 meters or more across. Experts think there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. So far, NASA has recorded about 8,000. This means about 17,000 are still not found.

In 2013, a 19-meter asteroid exploded in the sky above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia. It injured 1,200 people. This shows that these medium-sized asteroids can be very dangerous if they come near Earth or enter Earth’s orbit.

simplified: The Hunger Games happen once a year. The Capitol uses them to show the districts they are being punished for fighting it in the past. simplified: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids (PHAs) are space rocks that come close to Earth. They can pass within 7.5 million kilometres of the path Earth takes around the Sun. NASA has made a map of 1,400 PHAs. None of them are expected to be a danger in the next 100 years. With today’s technology, NASA can track these objects and predict if they might hit Earth. If there is a risk, NASA can send two kinds of missions to defend Earth.

simplified:
The Life of Pi tells an amazing story. It is about Pi, a teenage boy from India. His ship sinks. He is stuck in a small lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a very dangerous tiger.

It is the third book by the Canadian writer Yann Martel. It was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold more than seven million copies around the world. It has won many prizes and has been translated into 41 languages.

Martel’s father was a diplomat, a government worker in other countries. When Martel was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France, and Mexico.

It is the third book by the Canadian author Yann Martel, and was published in 2001. Since then, it has sold over seven million copies worldwide, won several prizes and been translated into 41 languages. Martel is the son of a diplomat and as a child lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

simplified: Sometimes we do not know why a bridge falls down. Engineers find the reason only after they do a full check. Sometimes the builders used poor materials. simplified:
I used to work five days a week.
After my parental leave, I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school.
I talked with my boss and asked to work less.
We agreed I would work only three days a week.
Because of this, my pay went down a lot.
I am paid pro rata. This means if I work fewer days, I get less money.
But my amount of work did not get smaller.
I am doing five days of work in only three days, and I get paid much less for it.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else.
Complex Document: I used to do a typical five-day week, but after I came out of my parental leave, I decided that I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school. After negotiating with my boss, we decided to cut my working week down to a three-day work week. This of course meant a significant cut in my pay too, as I'm paid on a pro-rata basis. I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it! 
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output:
I used to work five days a week.
After my parental leave, I wanted to spend more time with my children before they start school.
I talked with my boss and asked to work less.
We agreed I would work only three days a week.
Because of this, my pay went down a lot.
I am paid pro rata. This means if I work fewer days, I get less money.
But my amount of work did not get smaller.
I am doing five days of work in only three days, and I get paid much less for it.

simplified: I used to work a normal five-day week. After I returned from time off to care for my children, I wanted to spend more time with them before they start school. After talking with my boss, we agreed that I would work three days a week. This also meant my pay went down a lot, because I am paid only for the days I work. But I noticed that my workload did not get smaller. Now I do five days of work in three days, but I get paid much less.

I've since noticed, though, that my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest! I'm now doing five days' worth of work in three days, but getting paid much less for it! 
Simplified Document:

After talking with my boss, we agreed that I would work three days a week. This also meant my pay went down a lot, because I am paid only for the days I work. But I noticed that my workload did not get smaller. Now I do five days of work in three days, but I get paid much less.

Complex Document: Much of today's business is conducted across international borders, and while the majority of the global business community might share the use of English as a common language, the nuances and expectations of business communication might differ greatly from culture to culture. A lack of understanding of the cultural norms and practices of our business acquaintances can result in unfair judgements, misunderstandings and breakdowns in communication. Here are three basic areas of differences in the business etiquette around the world that could help stand you in good stead when you next find yourself working with someone from a different culture.
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output: Today, many businesses work across different countries. Many people use English, but the way people communicate in business can be very different in each culture. If you do not understand the cultural rules and habits of the people you work with, you may judge them unfairly. You may also misunderstand them, and this can cause communication problems. Here are three basic differences in business manners around the world. They can help you when you work with someone from another culture.

simplified: About 100,000 to 50,000 years ago, we see signs of early human life, like cave paintings. We do not know how this is linked to language. Brains did not suddenly get bigger, but people became smarter and did more difficult things. Did using language help their brains grow and change? Or did their smarter brains create language?

Complex Document: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, though, we start to see the evidence of early human civilisation, through cave paintings for example; no one knows the connection between this and language. Brains didn't suddenly get bigger, yet humans did become more complex and more intelligent. Was it using language that caused their brains to develop? Or did their more complex brains start producing language?

simplified: Many big supermarkets were criticized over the last ten years for unfair actions. They threw away a lot of food. They paid their suppliers too little. Their plastic packaging made too much waste and harmed the environment. But now supermarkets and grocery stores are starting to listen. Many customers are angry about plastic waste from packaging. Because of this, some of the biggest UK supermarkets have signed an agreement. They promise to change their packaging and cut plastic waste.

Complex Document: Many of the major supermarket chains have come under fire with accusations of various unethical acts over the past decade. They've wasted tonnes of food, they've underpaid their suppliers and they've contributed to excessive plastic waste in their packaging, which has had its impact on our environment. But supermarkets and grocers are starting to sit up and take notice. In response to growing consumer backlash against the huge amounts of plastic waste generated by plastic packaging, some of the largest UK supermarkets have signed up to a pact promising to transform packaging and cut plastic wastage.

simplified:
Wasfia Nazreen first saw a hula hoop when she was a young girl. A child from another country was visiting Bangladesh and playing with one. Wasfia could only stand and watch. In her country, many people thought girls should not hula-hoop or ride bikes.

Now Wasfia is one of the few people who have climbed the Seven Summits, the highest mountains on each continent. She climbed Everest and Kilimanjaro too. She is also the first person to hula-hoop on the top of each mountain. She does this to inspire women and girls in her country, where many people tell them not to do sports.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else.
Complex Document: Wasfia Nazreen first came across a hula hoop as a young girl, when she saw a foreign child who was visiting her native Bangladesh playing with one. Wasfia reluctantly stood by and watched, as in her country it was believed that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world to have climbed the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro, and the first to have hula-hooped on each peak. Her reason for doing so: to empower women and girls in a country which discourages them from doing sport. 
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output:
Wasfia Nazreen first saw a hula hoop when she was a young girl. A child from another country was visiting Bangladesh and playing with one. Wasfia could only stand and watch. In her country, many people thought girls should not hula-hoop or ride bikes.

Now Wasfia is one of the few people who have climbed the Seven Summits, the highest mountains on each continent. She climbed Everest and Kilimanjaro too. She is also the first person to hula-hoop on the top of each mountain. She does this to inspire women and girls in her country, where many people tell them not to do sports.

simplified:
Wasfia Nazreen saw a hula hoop for the first time when she was a young girl in Bangladesh. She saw a foreign child playing with one. Wasfia had to stand and watch, because in her country many people believed girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. 

Now she is one of the few people in the world who have climbed the Seven Summits, the highest mountains on each continent, including Everest and Kilimanjaro. She is also the first person to hula-hoop on each mountain. She does this to inspire and support women and girls in a country where many people tell them not to play sports.

simplified: From these results, we suggest that Girox Foods use a more people-focused management style. We should find ways to offer flexible work hours. We should also find ways to let employees work from places they choose, like home. Managers should find different ways to challenge staff. They should also give more praise and recognition for good work. We should spend more on training, especially on how to talk and work with people from different cultures. This will help create a positive workplace where employees can do their best work.

Complex Document: On the basis of these findings, we recommend that Girox Foods adopt a more people-oriented management style. As part of this, we should explore ways of offering more flexible working hours to our employees and consider how we can enable employees to work from their chosen locations. Managers need to consider a variety of ways to challenge our staff and provide more positive reinforcement and recognition of the work they do. Increased investment in professional development, especially in the area of social and intercultural communication, could also contribute to creating a positive environment for employees to produce their best work.

We should also find ways to let employees work from places they choose, like home. Managers should find different ways to challenge staff. They should also give more praise and recognition for good work. We should spend more on training, especially on how to talk and work with people from different cultures. This will help create a positive workplace where employees can do their best work.

simplified: In the past 200 years, technology and health care got better. Fewer children died young. This made the population grow quickly. Families were large. Many children lived to be adults and had their own children. In the 1960s, ways to stop pregnancy became easy to get. After that, the average number of babies per woman in the world fell from about six to about two.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else.
Complex Document: In the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant fewer children died young, fuelling rapid population growth. These large families produced even more children who survived into adulthood and had their own children. But with the wider availability of contraception in the 1960s, the global average number of babies per woman has declined from six babies per woman to as low as two.
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output: In the past 200 years, technology and health care got better. Fewer children died young. This made the population grow quickly. Families were large. Many children lived to be adults and had their own children. In the 1960s, ways to stop pregnancy became easy to get. After that, the average number of babies per woman in the world fell from about six to about two.

simplified: In the past 200 years, better technology and healthcare meant fewer children died young. This made the population grow quickly. Families were large, and many of those children grew up and had children of their own. But in the 1960s, birth control became easier to get. As a result, the average number of babies per woman around the world fell from about six to about two.

simplified:
Being more aware of differences in what people expect and how they act can help us avoid misunderstandings. But it is very important to remember that fixed ideas about a culture can harm good business relationships.

A person’s country can affect how they think and behave. But many other things shape us too. These include the area we come from, the groups or communities we belong to, our age and gender, the culture of our company, and our own life experiences.

So we should keep these possible differences in mind. However, we should not use them to judge or label everyone from one country as the same.
full_prompt:
Please simplify the following Complex Document to make it easier to read and understand by A2 CEFR level English learners. To simplify, you may replace difficult words with simpler ones, elaborate, or remove them when possible. You may also break down a lengthy sentence into shorter, clear sentences. Ensure the revised sentence is grammatically correct, fluent, and maintains the core message of the original without changing its meaning. Reply only with the simplified text, and nothing else.
Complex Document: Having an increased awareness of the possible differences in expectations and behaviour can help us avoid cases of miscommunication, but it is vital that we also remember that cultural stereotypes can be detrimental to building good business relationships. Although national cultures could play a part in shaping the way we behave and think, we are also largely influenced by the region we come from, the communities we associate with, our age and gender, our corporate culture and our individual experiences of the world. The knowledge of the potential differences should therefore be something we keep at the back of our minds, rather than something that we use to pigeonhole the individuals of an entire nation.
Simplified Document:
raw_model_output:

So we should keep these possible differences in mind. However, we should not use them to judge or label everyone from one country as the same.

simplified: Unlike many other famous musicians, Bruce Springsteen still releases new songs that become big hits. His shows fill big stadiums. He is still very good, even in his late 60s. simplified: There are more questions about how genes affect the brain and language. Did some genes change and help humans speak? Scientists found a gene change that happened 200,000 to 100,000 years ago. This change seems to be connected to speaking and to how the brain moves the mouth and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but this gene did not change in them. We still do not know how much genes affect language, but maybe one day we will find the answers in our DNA.

Complex Document: More questions lie in looking at the influence of genetics on brain and language development. Are there genes that mutated and gave us language ability? Researchers have found a gene mutation that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brains control our mouths and face. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It's too early to say how much influence genes have on language, but one day the answers might be found in our DNA.
